space.arim.api.platform

Interface PlatformFormattingParser<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the platform specific type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlatformMessages, BungeeMessages, SpigotMessages, SpongeMessages

    public interface PlatformFormattingParser<T>
    A utility which parses Strings, including colours, styles, or json features as specified.
    The type of the result depends on the specific platform.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T colour(String msg)
      Adds colour to a message according to '&' formatting codes.
      T colour(String msg, FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
      Adds colour to a message according to the specified formatting code char.
      default T parseJson(String msg)
      Parses Json messages based on RezzedUp's json.sk format.
      T parseJson(String msg, FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
      Parses Json messages based on RezzedUp's json.sk format.
      T parseUncolouredJson(String msg)
      Parses Json messages without explicitly parsing formatting codes.
      T uncoloured(String msg)
      Forms a message directly, without explicitly parsing formatting codes.

    • Method Detail

      • colour

        T colour(String msg,
         FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
        Adds colour to a message according to the specified formatting code char.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        formattingPattern - the pattern corresponding to the formatting code char
        Returns:
        a coloured Text object

      • colour

        default T colour(String msg)
        Adds colour to a message according to '&' formatting codes.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a coloured result

      • uncoloured

        T uncoloured(String msg)
        Forms a message directly, without explicitly parsing formatting codes.
        Note that, if colour remains in the input string, clients may still see colours.

        This method does not remove colour from a message! Use FormattingManipulator.stripFormatting(String) or FormattingManipulator.stripFormatting(String, FormattingCodePattern) instead.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a direct result

      • parseJson

        T parseJson(String msg,
            FormattingCodePattern formattingPattern)
        Parses Json messages based on RezzedUp's json.sk format.

        The following json tags are parsed: ttp, url, cmd, sgt, and ins.
        Colours are parsed according to the specified formatting code char.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        formattingPattern - the pattern corresponding to the formatting code char
        Returns:
        a json formatted result

      • parseJson

        default T parseJson(String msg)
        Parses Json messages based on RezzedUp's json.sk format.

        The following json tags are parsed: ttp, url, cmd, sgt, and ins.
        Colours are parsed according to '&' formatting codes.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a json formatted result

      • parseUncolouredJson

        T parseUncolouredJson(String msg)
        Parses Json messages without explicitly parsing formatting codes.
        Note that, if colour remains in the input string, clients may still see colours.
        Parameters:
        msg - the source message
        Returns:
        a json formatted result
